title.narrative: (WWF) Twinning Project for variable Renewable Power Development

sector.narrative: Energy generation, renewable sources - multiple technologies

title.narrative: By 2019, MoEE's power plan includes a target of at least 20% variable renewable power projects in the generation mix.

description.narrative:
By 2019, three MoEE departments and 22 officers and staff working on renewable energy and grid operations will have demonstrated capacity on on planning, feasibility study evaluation and economic analysis of integrating variable renewable power into the grid.
By end of project in February 2020, with 6 month extension, 6 MoEE departments, 32 officers and staffs working on renewable energy and grid operations have demonstrated capacity on planning, feasibility study evaluation, and economic analysis of integrating variable renewable power into the grid. Myanmar aims to meet its development goals of achieving 100% electrification by 2030, with a commitment to derive 8% of the power generation via renewable energy by 2021, increasing to 12% of renewable energy generation by 2025.
